title: Uncertainty Persists for Americans Waiting for Food Benefits After SNAP Ruling
summary: Judges on Friday ordered the federal government to continue providing food assistance during the shutdown. But benefits will still most likely be interrupted.

title: What Is Happening With SNAP Benefits During the Shutdown?
summary: President Trump said that he would heed court rulings ordering his administration to fund food stamps during the government shutdown, but there are complications.

title: SNAP Map: Here’s Who Will Be Affected by Disruptions to Food Aid
summary: More SNAP recipients live in Democratic districts. But the program touches every corner of the country.

title: NYC, Long a City of Contradictions, Is Still Turning Up New Ones
summary: New York City has often set the political, cultural and financial course of the country. Tuesday’s mayoral election — and a New Yorker watching from Washington — could scramble it all.

title: Far Right Targets Similarities Between Zohran Mamdani and Sadiq Khan
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the leading contender in the Nov. 4 New York election, and Sadiq Khan, London’s mayor, are liberal and Muslim, but they’re navigating varied politics, communities and cities.

title: Shutdowns, Obamacare and the Risks of Bargaining for Policy Wins in a Crisis
summary: A 2013 attempt to leverage minority power in a health care fight blew up on Republicans. Can today be different for Democrats?

title: Can South Korea Manage the Competing Needs of the U.S. and China?
summary: The country’s new president rolled out the red carpet for China’s leader, Xi Jinping, and President Trump this week, but the superpower rivalry is making it harder to balance relations.

title: Fed Risks a Recession if It Doesn’t Cut Rates Rapidly, Stephen Miran Warns
summary: Stephen I. Miran, the newest member of the central bank’s Board of Governors, thinks some of his colleagues are too worried about inflation.

title: California Promised Insurance Relief, But Delivered Loopholes
summary: New regulations were supposed to ensure that homeowners in fire zones would have coverage available. But companies can still avoid serving many high-risk areas, a Times investigation found.

title: Air Pollution Could Be Contributing to Your Slower Marathon Time
summary: Marathon runners consistently finished slower in cities with higher levels of dangerous particles in the air, researchers found.

title: Bros Need Some Bros
summary: Commercial camaraderie underscores how it’s lacking in real life.

title: Congress Is Dying in Real Time
summary: This is what happens when no one wants to govern.

title: Quality Time
summary: Daylight saving time ends tomorrow. The decrease in daylight can be destabilizing — and clarifying.

title: In One Jamaican Town, Hurricane Melissa Left Behind Floodwaters and Dead Livestock
summary: The Category 5 storm ravaged western Jamaica and drenched the small community of New River, where residents were coping with a massive clean up. At least 19 people have died nationwide, officials said.

title: After Days of Protests, Tanzania’s President Is Declared Election Winner
summary: Election monitors and members of the European Parliament have questioned the election’s integrity, and violent protests have rocked the country.

title: JD Vance Says He Hopes Usha Vance Embraces Christianity, Setting Off Backlash
summary: Critics included some Indian Americans, who said the remarks did not respect the religious decisions of Usha Vance, who grew up in a Hindu household.
